sub_title: Global EHS Leader | Inspiring people to shift their mindset about EHS, worldwide: From Priorities to Core Values. From Reaction to Proaction.
summary:
Professional with 15 years of proven career development and sustainable tracking of records in Global Companies in the Healthcare (Human and Animal Health), Chemical, Construction and Packaging business, supporting sites in Latin America, Asia Pacific, and Northwestern Europe Regions, within multicultural teams and environments in both Corporate and Site support levels.


Areas of expertise:

• Build and sustain Safety as a Core Value associated with Lean Manufacturing and Compliance mindsets within different organizations and cultures, reducing frequency of injuries and liabilities as a natural result of such journey

• Communicate clearly and consistently complex technical and regulatory information to both Management and Technical teams via common language, sustaining the culture of excellence

• Coach site operations leaders to be visible EHS advocates in their areas of responsibility, pursuing to turn them into EHS role models

Areas of proficiency:

• Use Problem Solving Techniques to identify and solve issues

• Deliver trainings and presentations to communicate effectively results and expectations to the different audience

• Resulted oriented, timely deliver on objectives within budgetary limits

Soft Skills:

• Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a larger team. Act with considerable independence to ensure compliance and drive personal ownership and accountability from all stakeholders

• Enthusiastic, disciplined, idealistic, with high ethical and integrity values. Build and cultivate collaborative relationships with stakeholders from different levels, managing conflicts and transforming EHS from a priority to a Core value

profile_positions.description:
• Lead the Safety, Biosafety and Process Safety teams from the Boxmeer, DeBilt and Stevensbeek sites, 
  in The Netherlands to translate and embrace on the Company core values`. 
• Facilitate the partnership and resources management to better serve Capital Investments and 
  Projects with Global Engineering Solutions (GES), Site Engineering (SE) and another key 
  stakeholders, digesting the Corporate and Regulatory requirements into actionable items.
• Manage Talent to build and sustain High Performing Teams, advocating for Diversity, Equity   
  and Inclusion as the embraced culture in the workplace, inspiring people to be Safe by Choice.
• Lead and drive the implementation of EHS programs ensuring compliance with both regulatory 
  and Company requirements as the minimum. Strive to excel the EHS support towards the 
  World Class EHS mindset, resulting in an injury-free environment and sustainable mindset.
profile_positions.title: EHS Associate Director | MSD Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
• EHS Lead for Pharmaceutical (Modalities: Tablet and Nasal Spray Manufacturing; Tablet, Nasal Spray, Vials and Vaccines Packaging) and Supply Chain Operations (including all D&L Warehouses)
• EHS partner for Capital Projects with Global 
 Engineering Solutions (GES).
• Co-coordinate Corporate Global project to revamp EHS Global Portal Platform and Information Management System (Knowledge Management System – KMS) liaising with EHS VP, EHS Senior Leadership Team and EHS members from NA, LATAM, EMEA and APAC regions.
• Coordinate internal audits and self-assessments to monitor program effectiveness and develop corrective/preventative actions to ensure continuous program improvements and sustainment.
• Coordinate Safety Committee with representatives from different areas, communicating results and driving actions to promote the culture of excellence.
• Support sites in AP Region to implement good practices and enhance their culture of excellence, when required.
profile_positions.title: EHS Lead | MSD Singapore

profile_positions.description:
• Loss prevention and fire brigade coordinator.
• Environmental Management and Sustainability and Remediation Management.
• Near miss program coordinator.
• Chemical management based on UN GHS standards.
• Process Safety Management - PSM.
• Dangerous goods transportation - DGT.
• Ergonomics, audit, bio risk and remediation projects.
• EHS guidance for projects.
• EHS compliance, ethic and sustainability on business.
profile_positions.title: EHS Specialist | MSD Brazil

profile_positions.description:
• Coordination of two main projects: Machinery and equipment protection (local requirement – NR-12) and Hazardous Energy Control from all Brazilian sites.
• Corporate support for all units WestRock in Brazil (07 sites among Pulp & Paper Mill, Corrugated and Paperboard, Packaging and Healthcare devices, Chemical and Forest).
• Ensure EHS of new projects with Corporate Engineering.
• Support to all units in Corporate audits, safety and health management system, as well as ISO/OHSAS certification.
• Compliance management, ergonomics, Loss Prevention (based on FM Global Guidelines) and Emergency Response.
• Guidelines deployment and development of local procedures for consolidation of the Occupational Safety and Health Management System.
• Support to Corporate Leadership Program in Occupational Safety – MWV Safety Leadership.
• Tracking and Performance Monitoring from Manufacturing, Packaging and Distribution Centers.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Safety Engineer - LatAm | Brazil

profile_positions.description:
• EHS assessment for new projects (CAPEX / OPEX).
• Corporate support to all Weber units in Brazil – 28 units (Industrial Plants, Distribution Centers and Mining).
• Standards, procedures, reports and EHS communication to Brazil sites.
• Incident Management, Fire Brigade, Emergency Response and other technical trainings.
• Support Behavior Based Safety Program – BBS (SafestartTM – Dupont) implementation.
profile_positions.title: EHS Corporate Analyst | Brazil

profile_positions.description:
• Coordinate the Chemical Management & Hazardous Communication Program.
• Support Industrial Hygiene (qualitative / quantitative assessment), Incident Management, Health campaigns, Risk Management and general EHS support.
• Environmental management – including global and local environmental reports (e.g. annual performance to Environmental and Social Report), waste, water and air management, EHS assessment in projects, liaising with local environmental agencies (CETESB and IBAMA), when necessary.
• Support debrief of Behavior Based Safety Program – Target Zero.
profile_positions.title: EHS Analyst Pl | MSD Brazil

profile_positions.description:
• Member of Environmental Committee - CMA / SINDAN.
• Responsible for Environmental permitting, Remediation projects, Waste Management, Pollution Control and Training.
• Support Compliance monitoring of EHS / internal and external audits, report of lagging and leading KPIs, Incident Management and Safety alerts.
• Member of PHA studies using HAZOP and ZHA techniques.
• Support implementation of Behavior Based Safety - BBS Program.
profile_positions.title: EHS Analyst Jr | Brazil

profile_positions.description:
• Support to Environmental Management System – ISO 14001 and Responsible Care certifications.
• Support for waste management (liquid and solid – hazardous and non-hazardous) and Remediation Projects.
• Support for environmental licensing processes, Compliance and Audits (internal and external).
• Participation in Emergency drills (team member, support and general organization).
• Developing, implementing and presentation of trainings / New employee EHS orientation.
profile_positions.title: EHS Trainee | Brazil
